scoring_rule: Each problem: ALL words must be correct. Level: 80% of problems must pass.

problems.prompt:
# Syllable Puzzle

Find 6 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
ous, nif, stan, haul, lis, sig, bagh, cant, ley, i, tened, dad, bigu, over, am

## Clues
1. ___ ___ — Relation hint: Example usage: Listen to the sound of this cello — listen and pay attention
2. ___ ___ — Relation hint: Synonym: John Rowlands — Welsh journalist and explorer who led an expedition to Africa in search of David Livingstone and found him in Tanzania in 1871; he and Livingstone together tried to find the source of the Nile River (1841-1904)
3. ___ ___ ___ ___ — Relation hint: Synonym: meaning — Of a digit or figure, ''see'' '''[masked] figure'''.
4. ___ ___ — Relation hint: Example usage: [masked] is one of the great cities of the Muslim world — capital and largest city of Iraq; located on the Tigris River
5. ___ ___ ___ — Relation hint: Synonym: equivocal — having no intrinsic or objective meaning; not organized in conventional patterns
6. ___ ___ — Relation hint: Synonym: redevelopment — A major repair, renovation, or revision.

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.
